alert.note: Alert for Alachua; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 11 at 9:50AM EDT until September 16 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Santa Fe River Near Worthington Springs affecting Union and Alachua Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Santa Fe River Near O`Leno State Park affecting Columbia and Alachua Counties. Additional information is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/forecasts.php?wfo=jax. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Santa Fe River Near Worthington Springs. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 56.0 feet, The boat ramp and floating dock at Chastain-Seay Park in Worthington Springs begin to flood. At 58.0 feet, Picnic Areas and campsites at Chastain-Seay Park in Worthington Springs begin to flood. At 59.0 feet, Chastain-Seay Park in Worthington Springs is generally closed to the public as access roads within the park become flooded. At 60.0 feet, A driveway near Southwest 102nd Court in Union County begins to flood at this level. Flooding along the river continues to impact boat ramps, docks and campgrounds in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 59.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EDT Sunday was 59.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 59.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 59.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
